data: Jeremiah Saunderson had remained in the low estate of a “probationer” for twelve years after he left the Divinity Hall, where he was reported so great a scholar that the Professor of Apologetics spoke to him deprecatingly, and the Professor of Dogmatics openly consulted him on obscure writers.
Divinity Hall | Professor of Apologetics | Professor of Dogmatics

Jeremiah Saunderson had remained in the low estate of a "probationer" for twelve years after he left the Divinity Hall, where he was reported so great a scholar that the Professor of Apologetics spoke to him deprecatingly, and the Professor of Dogmatics openly consulted him on obscure writers.
Maclaren, Ian, 1850-1907; Boyd, A. S. (Alexander Stuart), 1854-1930 [Illustrator]
